page.title: 19SHIPTON-ON-CHERWELL
page.content: Shipton-on-Cherwell is an Oxfordshire village. The Oxford Canal and river run by the village. There is a church, two post boxes, a telephone box, a village hall, about twenty small houses,and a few large expensive ones. One of these expensive houses is a recording studio for "Virgin Records". Twelve people are employed there, these twelve are from outside the village. The barn next to the house is used for recording.The artists who come, stay in the house. They are mostly popstars from the "Top 10". The main village was destroyed probably by the cement works. Most people in the village work in the quarry. In the village there is a coal yard which also hires out mini skips for rubbish.
